Does anyone know who Casimir Pulaski is?
 
 In Illinois, we have tomorrow (Mar. 3) off school for his holiday, but no one in our school knows who he is or what he did that makes him so special.

QUOTE]Later in 1778, through Washington's intervention, Congress approved the establishment of the Cavalry and put Pulaski at its head. The Father of the American Cavalry demanded much of his men and trained them in tested cavalry tactics. He used his own personal finances, when money from Congress was scarce, in order to assure his forces of the finest equipment and personal safety.[/QUOTE] I went to this site for the info...hope it answers your questions :) http://www.newbedford.k12.ma.us/elementary/casimir.htm
Yeah, I just remember he was a polish military leader during the revolution. A lot of Chicagoland schools get Casmir Pulaski day off because Chicago is heavily polish.
I live an hour south of chicago in a town that is not heavily polish and we get his birthday off.
I know, I live an hour south of Chicago too. That's why I said Chicagoland.

Crim, I didnt know you were from Chi town too! KEWL!!!!
 Plus we have a street named after him too. (Pulaski)
I don't remember ever seeing Pulaski Street up there. What streets are nearby?
